ISSUE.TITLE: Twitter: fetch an arbitrary user's timeline
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: > (1:05:01 PM) kylewm: snarfed: hey is it possible with twitter-activitystreams to list someone else's > tweets (for use with shrewdness)? i tried /(username)/@all but it's the same as /@me/@all > > (1:14:35 PM) snarfed: kylewm: yeah, rest api doesn't support it but it should. pretty easy fix, we just > need to add screen_name or user_id to API_SELF_TIMELINE_URL here: > https://github.com/snarfed/activitystreams-unofficial/tree/master/twitter.py#L183

COMMIT.MESSAGE: twitter: pass user_id to user_timeline api call This allows users to specify a screen name when fetching from group_id=@self. Addresses issue #18
